*The Three Sovereigns’ Esoteric Writings: A Legacy of Secrets*

**Title:** *The Three Sovereigns’ Esoteric Writings: A Legacy of Secrets*. Author unknown. Compiled by Daoist adepts of the Tang and Song dynasties, drawing from the remnants of works such as *The Three Sovereigns’ Esoteric Writings*, *The Yellow Thearch’s Yue Chapters*, and *The True Forms of the Five Marchmounts*. One scroll. Based on the text from the *Daoist Canon of the Zhengtong Era*, under the category of "Methods" in the *Dongshen* section.

---

**Postface to *The Three Sovereigns’ Esoteric Writings: A Legacy of Secrets***

The divine chapters of the Golden Watchtower are the silent, esoteric writings of the Three Sovereigns.
In Heaven, they align with Heaven as the Dao, governing the Five Phases, manifesting the myriad spirits, and presiding over the ten thousand forms.
On Earth, they harmonize with Earth as virtue, administering the ten thousand things, seizing spectral aberrations, and severing wayward spirits.
Thus, they constitute the supreme art of dominion and restraint, the most sacred and deathless Way.

Within them lie the latent workings of yin and yang and the six transformations, enabling the practitioner to avoid external calamities.
Dwelling in mountains, halting in grottoes and forests, cultivating truth and nurturing simplicity, seeking out the cliffs and valleys of the wilds—without this text, spectral beings would often bring ruin to one’s life and nature.
Even in the bustling markets and the chambers of houses, where years may pass without a human trace, spectral and wayward forces may yet linger—how much more so in the secluded valleys, the remote paths, and the fragrant depths of the forests?
To dwell in the mountains and guard stillness without possessing this text is to cast oneself into the very jaws of death.

Now, this text is bestowed to discern the true from the false, that later students of immortality may avoid misfortune and untimely harm to their lives.

Written in the year *bingwu* during the Chrysanthemum Festival, by the Purple Tenuity Daoist.

---

**The Three Sovereigns’ Esoteric Writings: A Legacy of Secrets**

**The Celestial Sovereign’s Esoteric Writings, Upper Scroll**

**The Celestial Sovereign’s Esoteric Writings, Upper Scroll**

Heaven births clouds and dragons; the Dao/Way fundamentally ascends. Radiant is the upright qi, resplendent in the Great Clarity. It aids and rectifies the true Dao/Way, proceeding in rectitude and balance. The six *jia* penetrate the primordial, the nine heavens transcend form. Blessings extend to descendants, and immortal practice becomes authentic.

Next, the Human Sovereign: humanity reveres longevity. The six *ding* and nine qi, secret and truly sincere—revere them, and ultimate felicity shall be yours. The August Emperor’s noble name has long known the Dao/Way’s wonders; the body enjoys enduring tranquility. Those who hear these true phrases shall perpetually embody their purity.

The above eighty characters: recite them silently once daily to seek the Dao/Way of longevity. Even for descendants, all shall attain enlightenment. Blessings extend to the seven ancestors, and fortune reaches a thousand lives. Exalted is the Great One, the true and correct jade script. It severs and extinguishes demonic perversity, harmonizing with the Jade Clarity. The immortal method is fundamentally correct; its name is inscribed in the Upper Clarity. The sagely work endures, and only upon its completion is it known. A flourishing destiny and great enterprise—the immortal host safeguards it. Thus is the golden script commanded, its mandate set by decree.

The above fifty-six characters: at each of the four seasons and eight solar terms, when offering sacrifices to ancestral kin, recite them silently seven times. Do not record them in the black register. The wise must not let others know, lest they be carelessly divulged. The transmission of this scripture conceals this prohibitive method.

The above six characters: after transmitting this *Three Sovereigns’ Esoteric Writings*, if the master does not cultivate practice for ten days, celestial spirits will not attend. If transmission is improper, it shall not be received. Only follow the prescribed method of transmission; do not let others treat it lightly.

Upon receiving the Three Sovereigns, one shall perpetually wander the Jade Clarity. Malevolence and evil shall be subdued and extinguished, and one shall forever dwell in mountain halls. Azure clouds follow me; the six *gui* preserve authenticity. Those who safeguard it shall have the six *jia* as their protectors. Do not slight our covenant, and you shall assuredly ascend to the Great Clarity. Your life shall be prolonged, your years extended; jade spirits shall support your form. For ten thousand kalpas, you shall be an immortal, perpetually abiding in the Cinnabar Heaven. The Five Peaks and Four Waterways, the cinnabar caves of mountain streams, the altars of the soil and springs—myriad spirits are arrayed therein. Wind Lords and Rain Masters, stars and constellations, all uphold the esoteric formulas.

The above eighty characters: on the days of the six *jia* and six *gui*, recite them thrice each. The spirits of the Five Peaks, Four Waterways, and altars of the soil shall protect and assist you.

All arcane words are secretly transmitted by the august spirits. Inscribed upon silk and hidden in grotto-heavens, merit returns to the Great Perfected, and blessings ferry across a thousand springs. Though countless kalpas pass and seas and mountains crumble to dust, this scripture remains concealed. Five-colored clouds cast their radiance; the multitudes revere it. Alas, how flourishing! Uphold and receive the pure teachings, and your life shall be prolonged, your years eternal.

The above fifty-six characters: after wearing the *Three Sovereigns’ Esoteric Writings*, transcribe the seal script and deposit it in the mountain wilds or grotto caves. Do not let others know, and you shall perpetually preserve a thousand springs. The numinous peaks and nine immortals, the blazing cinnabar grottoes—River Chariot and Heavenly Stem guard the Dao/Way’s arcane words. Those who recklessly divulge them shall be punished by the shortening of their lives, calamity reaching the nine springs. Their bodies shall be pulverized, their forms shattered—let not the golden script be spoken of. Be cautious! Be vigilant!

The above thirty-seven characters: after wearing the *Three Sovereigns’ Esoteric Writings*, if one discusses them with others or carelessly divulges them, calamity shall reach the nine ancestors. Bones shall be ground to powder, forms injured, and the golden script forever barred.

The arcane words total three hundred and fifteen characters.

**The Terrestrial Sovereign’s Esoteric Writings, Middle Scroll**

The kingdom harmonizes with the laws of pitch-pipes; the four seas all submit. Ethereal is the Jade Void, repelling perversity and preserving the spirit. For ten thousand kalpas, there shall be no peril. Neighboring lands and territories—blessings shall universally grace them. Banished are misfortune and calamity; virtue and fortune stand resplendent. Trust, reverence, clarity, and restraint—cultivate with utmost sincerity to preserve the spirit throughout the year. Return to the Dao/Way, relinquish the mundane, and diligently pursue the immortal records. Mountains and rivers, peaks and waterways—west, south, east, and north.

The above sixty-four characters: when traversing mountain valleys or dwelling by rivers and waterways, recite them silently once to repel evil beasts, flood dragons, venomous snakes, spectral perversities, *wangliang* demons, and demonic aberrations of all kinds.

The Terrestrial Sovereign’s secret seal harmonizes with heaven and earth. The Three Sovereigns’ true words radiate blessings to the nine springs. All sentient and insentient beings belong to the Supreme Mystery. Yin and yang generate each other; all things possess numinosity. The myriad classes of beings with consciousness all accord with the Dao/Way’s arts. Cultivate with reverence and sincerity, and you may anticipate ascension. Strive to perceive the mysterious and hidden; do not seek me in vain. Study the method with precision and persistence; do not harbor doubts. On peaks and waterways, all shall protect you. Revering the Three Scriptures—this is the rare and precious path.

The above eighty characters: when encountering difficulties among livestock, embryos, eggs, or creatures born of moisture, recite them silently once. The dead shall be liberated, and the living shall find peace. Do not let others hear these true phrases.

Rivers and seas, vast and mighty; pools and springs, arrayed and spread. Human and spirit alike employ them, their patterns conforming to the five directions. Bright stars and great spirits, the High Emperor’s jade script—repel peril and danger, protect the kingdom and its people. The dragon spirits of renowned rivers capture misfortune and dispel adversity. Peaks and waterways, famous mounds, the lunar Yin and the rigid continent—yellow dragons are arrayed in accordance with vows and supplications. The radiant Yang aids and rectifies; Daoists and lay followers alike know to revere these words. Their households shall be free of worry; demonic perversities and wayward qi shall never linger.

The above eighty characters: transcribe a clean copy, inscribe your name, and bury it among ancestral tombs as a declaration to the nine ancestors. Write in black ink on white paper, then seal it with black paper, also inscribing your name.

To navigate the world and seek life, this Dao/Way must be practiced. Through kalpas, one shall remain secure and untroubled, assuredly attaining longevity. Those who can safeguard it shall surely see prosperity and uprightness. Recite it ten thousand times, and jade maidens shall descend to welcome you. Kings keep it secret, and the kingdom shall universally know peace.

The above forty characters: regarding the talismanic script of the Three Sovereigns, recite it a hundred times to attain the longevity of earthbound immortals. Do not let fellow altar practitioners become aware, lest the work remain unaccomplished.

The arcane words total two hundred and sixty-four characters.

**The Human Sovereign’s Esoteric Writings, Lower Scroll**

Raise your gaze to the Heavenly Eye, where the radiant star and moon within the heart shine with youthful brilliance. The celestial luminaries traverse Qian and Kun, while earthly spirits receive the Dipper’s charge. Lin Zhen guards the earthly gate; Xun, Kan, Li, and Wu mark the human portal. Kun, Si, Dui, and You open the heavenly gate; Qian, Si, and Kan guard the ghostly gate. Gen and Wu oversee the head; Jia, Yi, Bing, Ding, Geng, Xin, Ren, and Yuan ascend with Bing above Xin.

The above fifty-seven characters: When preparing for a ritual offering, first transcribe a copy and burn it. The eight trigrams and twenty positions repel external malevolence from trespassing, while divine spirits safeguard the gates. Do not allow others to see or recite it.

Ride the celestial stem of Kuí and Lín; let humanity flourish in yang’s lament, granting longevity and prosperity. The nine heavens, nine lands, nine persons, nine destinies, nine perfected, nine Dao/Ways, nine arts, nine births, nine vastnesses, nine mysteries, nine essentials, and nine accomplishments—along with the one hundred and seventeen transcendent powers—ascend with Zhang Tian Gong, ensuring the world’s goodness without revelation.

The above fifty-one characters: When entering mountains or waters to subdue malevolent spirits, inscribe them in black on white silk and burn it over water to quell them. Do not let others know of this.

Summon the Dragon Spirit of the Nine Constructions: Remove, Full, Level, Establish, House, Ascend, Bright, Divine, Know, Bend, Destiny, Hook, Support, Bright, Fire, Three Persons, Radiance, Nine Heavens, and other spirits. The great Six Ghosts and Azure Omens retreat; destiny ascends in obeisance. Three flames must blaze; three stones and nine kings expel deceit. Hasten! Three Qian must not; nine nines transform nine heavens, nine oxen, two persons, fish, and transgressions. The world remains pure, and the nine unite in brightness, issuing destiny left and right.

The above seventy-four characters: Write with realgar on stone or tile and bury at the four corners of your dwelling. Do not let others know, for this summons the Wealth Spirit and Prosperity Spirit.

Four stones, mountain foxes, issuing destiny, prosperity’s gate—thus, women find peace within. Speak the words of Ye Liao; six left leaves, nine heavens, nine heavens, nine heavens—accomplished! This azure one!

The above thirty-four characters: Follow one seal script, write in red on white paper, and burn it daily on an empty stomach. Mix the ashes with water and consume. If the divine words foretell fortune, fortune comes; if misfortune, misfortune follows. Exhale to cure illness—none shall remain uncured.

The arcane words total two hundred and sixteen characters.

The above constitutes the **Esoteric Writings of the Three Sovereigns**. Those who study the Dao/Way must carry them, for only then may they commune with the divine. If one has not received the Daoist registers, they must not recklessly practice this. It is fitting to conceal them within renowned mountains and secluded valleys to avoid heavenly retribution. This method was not transmitted by the original master, lest the celestial mechanisms be revealed. Fellow students must speak sparingly of it, for slander against these sacred texts brings calamity upon oneself—suffering under royal law in life and hell in death. Be cautious, be most cautious; keep it secret, keep it most secret.

**The Secret Seal of the Yellow Spirit of Great Clarity**
Carve from the heartwood of a jujube tree struck by lightning, on the fifth day of the fifth month, or on a spring Jiazi day, or a summer Bingwu day.

For all who receive and hold this seal: On a Jiazi day at the hour of *rending* (9–11 PM), place it in a purified chamber. Offer three platters of fried cakes, cypress broth, and salted fermented beans. Bow twice and present incense. Declare: *"Today, this humble servant [your name] respectfully addresses the Dao Lord, August Heaven, and the Messenger of the Great Unity. I now carry this precious seal, wishing for freedom from illness within and the severance of all malevolence without. May it protect heaven and humanity, dispel spirits, and repel evil. May all I seek come naturally, uniting with the Dao/Way."* Present incense thrice, bow again, and conclude the petition.

**Diagram of the Yellow Spirit Seal of Great Clarity**
Square, 4.8 *cun* per side, 1.2 *cun* thick.

**Diagram of the Small Yue Chapter Seal**
Square, 4.8 *cun* per side, 1.2 *cun* thick.

**Diagram of the Nine Elders of the Immortal Capital Seal**
Perfectly square, 3.2 *cun* per side, 0.8 *cun* thick, with two lines of seal script.

The **Upper Clarity Seal of the Nine Elders of the Immortal Capital**: When carried while climbing mountains, wolves, tigers, and spectral beings submit of their own accord. Rivers and winds yield to safe passage. It commands the immortal officials and soldiers of grotto heavens. Wolves cannot harm, tigers cannot wound, waters cannot drown. In times of great peril, salvation is assured. For ordinary people, it extends lifespan, subdues malevolent ghosts, and repels all evil. To treat night terrors and convulsions in children, or various ailments in adults, burn it to ash, mix with frankincense decoction, and consume—efficacy is immediate. It hastens difficult births and expels stillborn fetuses, stabilizes pregnancies, and grants conception to barren women. It resolves curses, grievances, and injustices, sharpens the mind, and fulfills all uses. Treat it with reverence; do not slight it.

**The Inner Method of the Yellow Spirit Yue Chapter**

**Lineage of Masters**
Marshal Yuan Bo, with a blessed countenance and fiery crown, clad in golden armor, wielding a sword, and dressed in vermilion robes and shoes.

**The Talisman of the Great Mystery’s Messenger**
**Summoning Incantation**: *"Xuan Ying Lie Hong."*
**Summoning Talisman**: Visualize the officers and soldiers descending from the Dipper before you. Hold the talisman in the left hand and grasp it in the right, drawing the spirit’s qi and blowing it onto the talisman. Use the secret incantation where essence departs.

The **Secret Seal of the Yellow Spirit Yue Chapter** subdues all malevolence, along with various spectral disasters and urgent calamities. When meeting kings and great ministers, all shall rejoice, and all desires shall be fulfilled. Carry it constantly at the waist or in the sleeve, and hidden soldiers shall guard and assist. Do not recklessly transmit it to the unworthy, lest you incur heavenly retribution, bringing misfortune upon nine generations—regret shall be too late.

**Incantation of the Yue Chapter**:
*"The Yellow Spirit Yue Chapter of the Most High Lord Lao slays and vanquishes the ghostly soldiers of heaven and earth—how dare they resist! The Eastern Star of the Year, the Western Venus, the Northern Pole Star, the Southern Mars—great sages transform, annihilating ghostly essences, executing thieves and bandits, subduing all armies. Immortal youths and jade maidens, celestial and terrestrial spirits, Zhang Star drives away and captures all malevolent qi. The Well and Willow Stars transmit, the Horn Star pacifies. Demons and goblins are governed by destiny and summoned to the imperial court. The Three and Five govern malevolent qi, seize the register of death, inscribe the name of life. The stem of Wu destroys, the spirit of Yi is refined. Heavenly immortals descend to the disciple Yue Chapter. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law and command of the Most High Lord Lao!"*

**Incantation of the Seal**:
*"Yellow Spirit of Heavenly Chapter, the imperial seal of the Yellow Spirit of the Celestial Court, capturing ghostly essences. The Eastern Dipper establishes the node by the Star of the Year; the Southern Dipper governs destiny and repels all armies. The Western Dipper’s Ladle and Scoop subdue ghostly essences; the Northern Dipper binds essence and reports to the imperial court. The Yellow Spirit slays ghosts and their qi alike; the Central Dipper’s Great Ladle is the Star of Mars."*

The Horn and Neck govern the assembly of qi and names, the Star of Zhang and Fire expel the myriad armies. The Great Sage transforms spirits and slays rampant qi, the Ox, Sequence, Winnowing Basket, and Dipper shield the body’s form. The Stem of Wu and the Emperor of the Five Stars bestow longevity, the Celestial Sovereign’s Envoys slay malevolent essences. The Most High bestows upon your servant this Yellow Spirit Seal—swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law and command!

**Incantation to Slay Ghosts**:
*"Most High Lord Lao, teach me to slay ghosts, grant me divine methods. Above, I summon the Jade Maidens to gather and seize inauspiciousness. Ascend the mountain, and the rocks split; wear the seal, don the floral canopy, tread upon the Ladle and Stem. To the left, the Six Jia spirits lend support; to the right, the Six Ding spirits guard. Before me stands the Yellow Spirit; behind me, the Yue Chapter. Divine marshals strike and slay, unyielding to the mighty. First, they slay evil ghosts; next, they sever the night’s radiance. What spirit would not submit? What ghost would dare resist?"*
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law and command!

**Command Against Pestilence**:
*"I command the Eastern Green Pestilence ghosts, the essence of rotting wood; the Southern Red Pestilence ghosts, the essence of scorching fire; the Western White Pestilence ghosts, the essence of hollow metal; the Northern Black Pestilence ghosts, the essence of abyssal pools; the Central Yellow Pestilence ghosts, the essence of filth and earth. Born of the four seasons and eight nodes, thriving in their vigor, spirits unnurtured within turn outward to craft malevolent essences. The qi of the Five Poisons enters the human form, now cold, now hot, unsettling the five limbs. O Nine Ugly ghosts, I know your names—depart swiftly, tarry not!"*
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law and command!

Respectfully recorded: In the fourth year of Han’an, the Ancestral Celestial Master battled the Six Heavens’ Demon Kings in Shu, seizing the Twenty-Four Governances. At the Yellow Emperor’s altar on Mount Qingcheng, a covenant was sworn. Humans dwell in yang brightness; ghosts lurk in yin darkness. The Six Heavens’ Demon Kings were banished to the Northern Capital, the Eight Divisions’ ghostly marshals and their hosts driven into the Western Regions. The Five Phases’ toxic qi were thus released. Stone was split into contracts, carved with the forms of Heaven, Earth, Sun, and Moon, placed upon sheer cliffs. The divine seal encircled the ghostly encampments, severing their communication.

Now, these sacred talismans are disseminated. The devout should enshrine them in a purified chamber with incense and offerings. Naturally, they will dispel pestilence, repel evil, gather blessings, and summon auspiciousness. Only with utmost sincerity will there be no lack of response.
*Reverently proclaimed by the Orthodox Unity Original Altar of Mount Longhu.*

The *Baopuzi* states: "The ancients all wore this seal, which could repel tigers, leopards, and all mountain beasts. When sealing mud with this seal and placing it a hundred paces in each of the four directions, tigers and wolves will not approach. If one encounters fresh tiger tracks while traveling, imprinting the seal in alignment will drive the tiger away; imprinting it in reverse will summon the tiger. Not only tigers and wolves—if mountain forest shrines or blood-offering spirits capable of bringing fortune or misfortune are sealed with mud blocks in the four directions, their traces will no longer manifest their numinous power.

Once, there was a stone in a deep pool, atop which perched a great turtle that wrought calamity as a spirit. A Daoist named Dai Bing used several hundred blocks of sealed mud, casting them from a boat into the pool. After a long while, a turtle over a *zhang* in length floated motionless to the surface, while smaller turtles gathered upon the water. Those afflicted by its harm were immediately healed, and the place is now called Turtle Pool.

If one recites this text while visualizing a red youth guarding the heart, performing twenty-four breaths, and inscribes talismans five *cun* tall and four *cun* wide—twenty-four in total—then all birds and beasts, no matter how fierce, will flee. Command them to halt, and they halt; command them to act, and they obey. Not only tigers and leopards—sealing ghostly shrines with this talisman yields great efficacy.

The Most High said: "To command ghosts and spirits, first take equal parts of ghost arrows and ghost days, two *liang* each, dry them in the shade, and grind them into fine powder. Mix with mulberry sap to form pills the size of *wutong* seeds. Take seven pills on an empty stomach at dawn, swallowing them with pure water, and take seven more before going out. After forty-nine days, all ghosts and spirits, the Eight Officers, the Six Ding, and the Jade Maiden will come to pay homage, and even lions and tigers will submit to your command. After forty-nine days, do not take any more.

When taking the pills, inhale a mouthful of qi from the direction of the season’s vigor and recite the incantation:
*'Essence of a hundred medicines, eyes behold ghostly forms. Command the Eight Officers and the Six Ding, drive and employ ghosts and spirits, instantly attain communion. Prolong years and extend life, forever achieve longevity, ascend to Heaven in broad daylight, soar to the Supreme Clarity.'*
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law and command!

The direction of vigor refers to east in spring, south in summer, west in autumn, and north in winter. Use this with utmost sincerity to treat illnesses caused by malevolent forces—there will be no lack of response.

**Talisman for Body Protection**"

**Talismans of the True Forms of the Five Marchmounts**

**Eastern Marchmount: Mount Tai**
The Eastern Marchmount, Mount Tai, is the sacred peak of Yanzhou, known as the Grotto-Heaven of Blue Mystery. Located in Tai’an Prefecture, it is assisted by Mount Culai and Mount Changbai. It is enfeoffed as the Heavenly-Peace Great Life Benevolent Sage Emperor.

*Talisman of the True Form of the Eastern Marchmount*

**Southern Marchmount: Mount Heng**
The Southern Marchmount, Mount Heng, is the sacred peak of Jingzhou, known as the Grotto-Heaven of Vermilion Radiance. Located in Hengshan County, it is assisted by Mount Qian and Mount Huo. It is enfeoffed as the Heaven-Supervising Illustrious Sage Emperor. It governs the essential matters of water regulation.

*Talisman of the True Form of the Southern Marchmount*

**Western Marchmount: Mount Hua**
The Western Marchmount, Mount Hua, is the sacred peak of [the region], known as the Grotto-Heaven of the Assembly of Immortals. Located in Huayin County, it is assisted by Mount Earth-Lung and Mount Woman’s Loom. It is enfeoffed as the Metal-Heaven Compliant Sage Emperor. It oversees the affairs of the feathered creatures.

*Talisman of the True Form of the Western Marchmount*

**Northern Marchmount: Mount Heng**
The Northern Marchmount, Mount Heng, is the sacred peak of Bingzhou, known as the Grotto-Heaven of the Assembly of Mystery. Located in Quyang County of Dingzhou, it is assisted by Mount Feng and Mount Baodu. It is enfeoffed as the Peaceful Heaven Primordial Sage Emperor. It governs the ripening of the five grains and fruits.

*Talisman of the True Form of the Northern Marchmount*

The Central Marchmount, Mount Song, is known as the Grotto-Heaven of the Controller of Authenticity. Located in Dengfeng County of Henan Prefecture, it is assisted by Mount Shaoshi and Mount Wudang. It is enfeoffed as the Central Heaven Revered Sage Emperor. It oversees the affairs of the earth, soil, mountains, and valleys.

*Talisman of the True Form of the Central Marchmount*

The Esoteric Writings of the Three Sovereigns Concluded.

chunks.original_text: 三皇内文遗秘 经名：三皇内文遗秘。 撰人不祥。 系唐宋道士纂集六期时《三皇内文》、《黄神越章》、《五岳真形图》等书遗文改编而成。 一卷。 底本出处《正统道藏》洞神部方法类。 三皇内文遗秘 三皇内文遗秘后序 金阙神章，三皇默秘之文也。 在天与天为道，而统五行，着万神，主万象。 在地与地为德，宰万物，擒精怪，斩邪神。 故为无上御摄之法，至神不死之道也。 内隐阴阳六化之功，使修行之人，不遭外患。 居山止洞林境，修真养素，求访山中岩谷，若非斯文，则精怪以祸人之性命者多矣。 故世市闹宅，堂室舍宇之中，或年深绝於无人之迹，精邪尚有存焉，而况於探山幽谷，穷路林芳之处也。 居山守静，若不怀斯文者，如将身自投於死地。 今降斯文，以辨邪正，令后学仙之士，不遭祸患，横伤命耳。 时年丙午菊节，紫微道人序。 三皇内文遗秘 天皇内文上

chunks.original_text: 天生云龙，道本上升，张烈正气，丽乎太清，辅弼正道，行於正平，六甲洞元，九天超形，福延子孙，仙行自真，次及人皇，人敬长生，六丁九气，秘密真诚，敬之终吉，昊帝贵名，久知道妙，身体长宁，闻此真句，常任之清。 已上八十字，每日暗念一徧，求长生之道。 及於子孙，亦得总明。 庆延七祖，福及千生，高上太一，真正玉文，斩灭祆邪，和合玉清，仙法本正，名书上清，圣功乃久，法成乃知，昌运大业，仙众保之，乃命金文，扉命制期。 已上五十六字，每遇四时八节，飨祭家亲，暗念七徧，不书黑簿。 智者勿令人知之恐轻泄也。 经传隐此法禁。 已上六字，说此三皇内文传受已，师不用功行及十日，天神不附。 若传度非法，亦不得受。 只依科所传，勿令人轻慢。 授及三皇，常游玉清，凶恶伏灭，永居山堂，青云从我，六癸存真，人若保之，六甲护身，勿轻我盟，必升太清，永命延寿，玉神扶形，万劫为仙，常处丹天，五岳四渎，川洞丹穴，社稷泉源，万灵布设，风伯雨师，星辰拥诀。 已上八十字，六甲六癸日，各念持三徧，五岳四渎社稷等神护助也。 凡有玄言，皇神秘传，写於缯素，藏於洞天，功归太真，福度千春，无穷劫过，海岳成尘，秘之斯文，五云覆映，兆民敬之，吁和昌运，持受清教，命延寿永。 已上五十六字，言三皇内文佩受之后，仍写篆送在山野洞穴之中。 勿令人知，永保千春。 灵岳九仙，丹炎洞然，河魁天罡，护道玄言，妄泄伐命，殃及九泉，粉躯碎体，金文莫言。 已哉矣慎焉。 已上三十七字，言三皇内文佩受之后，说论与人，轻意妄泄，殃及九祖，粉骨伤形，金文永隔。 玄言三百一十五字。 地皇内文中 国合律法，四海咸归，飘飘玉虚，辟邪保神，万劫无虞，旁生国土，福皆沾之，却灭凶殃，福德堂堂，信钦明约，至诚修学，保神终年，归道舍俗，精勤仙录，山川岳渎，西南东北。 已上六十四字，行於山谷，寓於江渎，暗念一徧，能辟恶兽蛟龙、毒蛇精邪、魍魉祆怪之类也。 地皇秘印，和叶天地，三皇真言，福辉九泉，有情蠢动，皆属上玄，阴阳相生，物皆有灵，含识众类，皆合道艺，修饰虔诚，可期飞升，力感玄幽，无妄我求，学法精持，无使狐疑，岳渎水上，咸令护之，敬崇三文，是即为希。 已上八十字，遇有六畜及胎卵湿化等类有难，暗念一徧，死者解脱，生者安乐。 勿令人知闻此真句也。 河海洪江，池源列张，人神动用，轨契五方，明星大神，高帝玉文，却绝险厄，护国兆民，名川龙神，摄祸去迍，岳渎名丘，太阴刚州，黄龙配列，依愿应求，阳明辅弼，道士俗流，知敬斯言，家属无忧，祆妄邪气，终不稽留。 已上八十字，净写一本，着姓名，埋祖先冢墓之间，以为九玄告矣。 黑书白纸，外以黑纸封之，却亦着姓名是也。 处世求生，其道必行，历劫安畅，决定长生，善能保守，必见亨贞，诵之万徧，玉女下迎，王者秘之，合国咸宁。 已上四十字，说三皇之符文，念之百徧，保达地仙长寿。 勿令同坛人觉，恐功不成。 玄言二百六十四字。 人皇内文下
chunks.translated_text:
**The Celestial Sovereign’s Esoteric Writings, Upper Scroll**

Heaven births clouds and dragons; the Dao/Way fundamentally ascends. Radiant is the upright qi, resplendent in the Great Clarity. It aids and rectifies the true Dao/Way, proceeding in rectitude and balance. The six *jia* penetrate the primordial, the nine heavens transcend form. Blessings extend to descendants, and immortal practice becomes authentic.

Next, the Human Sovereign: humanity reveres longevity. The six *ding* and nine qi, secret and truly sincere—revere them, and ultimate felicity shall be yours. The August Emperor’s noble name has long known the Dao/Way’s wonders; the body enjoys enduring tranquility. Those who hear these true phrases shall perpetually embody their purity.

The above eighty characters: recite them silently once daily to seek the Dao/Way of longevity. Even for descendants, all shall attain enlightenment. Blessings extend to the seven ancestors, and fortune reaches a thousand lives. Exalted is the Great One, the true and correct jade script. It severs and extinguishes demonic perversity, harmonizing with the Jade Clarity. The immortal method is fundamentally correct; its name is inscribed in the Upper Clarity. The sagely work endures, and only upon its completion is it known. A flourishing destiny and great enterprise—the immortal host safeguards it. Thus is the golden script commanded, its mandate set by decree.

The above fifty-six characters: at each of the four seasons and eight solar terms, when offering sacrifices to ancestral kin, recite them silently seven times. Do not record them in the black register. The wise must not let others know, lest they be carelessly divulged. The transmission of this scripture conceals this prohibitive method.

The above six characters: after transmitting this *Three Sovereigns’ Esoteric Writings*, if the master does not cultivate practice for ten days, celestial spirits will not attend. If transmission is improper, it shall not be received. Only follow the prescribed method of transmission; do not let others treat it lightly.

Upon receiving the Three Sovereigns, one shall perpetually wander the Jade Clarity. Malevolence and evil shall be subdued and extinguished, and one shall forever dwell in mountain halls. Azure clouds follow me; the six *gui* preserve authenticity. Those who safeguard it shall have the six *jia* as their protectors. Do not slight our covenant, and you shall assuredly ascend to the Great Clarity. Your life shall be prolonged, your years extended; jade spirits shall support your form. For ten thousand kalpas, you shall be an immortal, perpetually abiding in the Cinnabar Heaven. The Five Peaks and Four Waterways, the cinnabar caves of mountain streams, the altars of the soil and springs—myriad spirits are arrayed therein. Wind Lords and Rain Masters, stars and constellations, all uphold the esoteric formulas.

The above eighty characters: on the days of the six *jia* and six *gui*, recite them thrice each. The spirits of the Five Peaks, Four Waterways, and altars of the soil shall protect and assist you.

All arcane words are secretly transmitted by the august spirits. Inscribed upon silk and hidden in grotto-heavens, merit returns to the Great Perfected, and blessings ferry across a thousand springs. Though countless kalpas pass and seas and mountains crumble to dust, this scripture remains concealed. Five-colored clouds cast their radiance; the multitudes revere it. Alas, how flourishing! Uphold and receive the pure teachings, and your life shall be prolonged, your years eternal.

The above fifty-six characters: after wearing the *Three Sovereigns’ Esoteric Writings*, transcribe the seal script and deposit it in the mountain wilds or grotto caves. Do not let others know, and you shall perpetually preserve a thousand springs. The numinous peaks and nine immortals, the blazing cinnabar grottoes—River Chariot and Heavenly Stem guard the Dao/Way’s arcane words. Those who recklessly divulge them shall be punished by the shortening of their lives, calamity reaching the nine springs. Their bodies shall be pulverized, their forms shattered—let not the golden script be spoken of. Be cautious! Be vigilant!

The above thirty-seven characters: after wearing the *Three Sovereigns’ Esoteric Writings*, if one discusses them with others or carelessly divulges them, calamity shall reach the nine ancestors. Bones shall be ground to powder, forms injured, and the golden script forever barred.

The arcane words total three hundred and fifteen characters.

**The Terrestrial Sovereign’s Esoteric Writings, Middle Scroll**

The kingdom harmonizes with the laws of pitch-pipes; the four seas all submit. Ethereal is the Jade Void, repelling perversity and preserving the spirit. For ten thousand kalpas, there shall be no peril. Neighboring lands and territories—blessings shall universally grace them. Banished are misfortune and calamity; virtue and fortune stand resplendent. Trust, reverence, clarity, and restraint—cultivate with utmost sincerity to preserve the spirit throughout the year. Return to the Dao/Way, relinquish the mundane, and diligently pursue the immortal records. Mountains and rivers, peaks and waterways—west, south, east, and north.

The above sixty-four characters: when traversing mountain valleys or dwelling by rivers and waterways, recite them silently once to repel evil beasts, flood dragons, venomous snakes, spectral perversities, *wangliang* demons, and demonic aberrations of all kinds.

The Terrestrial Sovereign’s secret seal harmonizes with heaven and earth. The Three Sovereigns’ true words radiate blessings to the nine springs. All sentient and insentient beings belong to the Supreme Mystery. Yin and yang generate each other; all things possess numinosity. The myriad classes of beings with consciousness all accord with the Dao/Way’s arts. Cultivate with reverence and sincerity, and you may anticipate ascension. Strive to perceive the mysterious and hidden; do not seek me in vain. Study the method with precision and persistence; do not harbor doubts. On peaks and waterways, all shall protect you. Revering the Three Scriptures—this is the rare and precious path.

The above eighty characters: when encountering difficulties among livestock, embryos, eggs, or creatures born of moisture, recite them silently once. The dead shall be liberated, and the living shall find peace. Do not let others hear these true phrases.

Rivers and seas, vast and mighty; pools and springs, arrayed and spread. Human and spirit alike employ them, their patterns conforming to the five directions. Bright stars and great spirits, the High Emperor’s jade script—repel peril and danger, protect the kingdom and its people. The dragon spirits of renowned rivers capture misfortune and dispel adversity. Peaks and waterways, famous mounds, the lunar Yin and the rigid continent—yellow dragons are arrayed in accordance with vows and supplications. The radiant Yang aids and rectifies; Daoists and lay followers alike know to revere these words. Their households shall be free of worry; demonic perversities and wayward qi shall never linger.

The above eighty characters: transcribe a clean copy, inscribe your name, and bury it among ancestral tombs as a declaration to the nine ancestors. Write in black ink on white paper, then seal it with black paper, also inscribing your name.

To navigate the world and seek life, this Dao/Way must be practiced. Through kalpas, one shall remain secure and untroubled, assuredly attaining longevity. Those who can safeguard it shall surely see prosperity and uprightness. Recite it ten thousand times, and jade maidens shall descend to welcome you. Kings keep it secret, and the kingdom shall universally know peace.

The above forty characters: regarding the talismanic script of the Three Sovereigns, recite it a hundred times to attain the longevity of earthbound immortals. Do not let fellow altar practitioners become aware, lest the work remain unaccomplished.

The arcane words total two hundred and sixty-four characters.

chunks.original_text: 举目自天目心中明星月少小功曜乾坤而地祇斗授林震地户巽坎离午人门坤巳兑酉天门乾巳坎子鬼门艮戊头甲乙丙丁庚辛壬元丙上辛。 已上五十七字，欲祭醮，先写一本焚之。 八卦二十位，外邪不悮犯，神明护门。 不得令人见读。 乘天罡魁林人生阳哀人寿昌九天九土九人九命九真九道九术九生九渺九玄九要九成凡百一十七与超天张天公良世勿明。 已上五十一字，凡欲入山水摄邪精，黑书白绢上焚之水伏。 勿令人知之。 命龙神九建除满平定房上明神知要屈命句扶明火三人光九天等神大出六鬼苍爻远命上拜必炎三石九王奸出勿勿必明三乾勿九九九天化九牛二人鱼罪世白无九同明出命左右。 已上七十四字，用雌黄书於石瓦上，埋於本宅住处四角。 勿令人知之，招财神禄神也。 四石山狐出命昌门矣也女安於即言中耶聊六左扉九天九天九天成焉三矣此苍矣。 已上三十四字，依一篆於朱书白纸，每日空心焚之，灰水调服之。 如神语言吉即吉，凶即凶。 呵气治病，无不瘥矣。 玄言二百一十六字毕矣。 已上三皇内文，学道之士须佩带之，然后方始通神。 如未受道箓之人，不得妄行。 宜埋藏於名山岩谷之中，免遭天谴。 此法本师不度，恐泄天机。 同学之士，切令少言，恐毁谤灵文，於身有祸，生遭王法，死遭地狱。 慎之慎之，秘之秘之。 太清黄神越章秘印 用雷震枣木心，於五月五日，或春甲子日，或夏丙午日刻之。 凡受持印者，以甲子日人定时，净室安置印，以煎饼、栢汤、盐豉，为三楪，供献，再拜上香。 今日小兆臣某，上白　道君皇天太一使者。 某今佩持宝印，愿内无疾病，外断诸祆，救护天人，除精却恶，所求自然，与道合同。 上香三启，再拜　奏还。 太清黄神印图　方四寸八分　一寸二分 小越章印图　方四寸八分　厚一寸二分 九老仙都印图　长阔各方正　三寸二分厚　八分篆二行 上清九老仙都印，佩之登山，狼虎精怪自伏，江河风雨顺济。 可管洞府仙官吏兵，狼不能害，虎不能伤，水不能溺，临大危难，必有善生。 常人佩之，寿命延年，伏诸邪鬼，百恶不侵。 治小儿夜啼惊风，及大人诸般疾患，并烧灰，用乳香汤调下，立效。 催生下死胎，佩之安胎。 妇人无子，佩之有孕。 解咒诅冤枉，令人聪明，用之皆应。 得之崇敬，慎勿轻慢。 太上黄神越章内法 师派 帅将元伯，福相火冠，金甲仗剑，朱衣朱履。 太玄符使章 召咒：玄英烈宏。 召符 存将吏从斗中降在目前， 左卯文，右执符，视将取气吹符上，或精去处用秘咒。 黄神越章秘印，能制伏万邪，及诸祆怪灾害急难，拜见国王大臣，并皆欢喜，所求遂心。 常带腰袖间，阴兵护助。 不可乱传非人，恐遭天谴，殃及九祖，后悔难矣。 越章咒曰： 太上老君黄神越章，斩伐天地鬼神吏兵，何敢承当。 东岁星、西太白、北辰星、南荧惑，大圣化，灭鬼精，诛盗贼，伏万兵。 仙童玉女天地灵，张星驱摄万邪气，井柳星传角星平，魑魅治命会帝庭。 三五治邪气，掇死籍，上生名，罡武灭，乙神精。 天仙降下弟子越章。 急急如太上老君律令勅。 印章咒曰： 黄神天章，帝庭黄神之印，摄鬼精。 东斗建节由岁星，南斗治命辟万兵，西斗魁勺鬼精，北斗束精告帝庭。 黄神斩鬼与气并，中斗大魁荧惑星。

Raise your gaze to the Heavenly Eye, where the radiant star and moon within the heart shine with youthful brilliance. The celestial luminaries traverse Qian and Kun, while earthly spirits receive the Dipper’s charge. Lin Zhen guards the earthly gate; Xun, Kan, Li, and Wu mark the human portal. Kun, Si, Dui, and You open the heavenly gate; Qian, Si, and Kan guard the ghostly gate. Gen and Wu oversee the head; Jia, Yi, Bing, Ding, Geng, Xin, Ren, and Yuan ascend with Bing above Xin.

The above fifty-seven characters: When preparing for a ritual offering, first transcribe a copy and burn it. The eight trigrams and twenty positions repel external malevolence from trespassing, while divine spirits safeguard the gates. Do not allow others to see or recite it.

Ride the celestial stem of Kuí and Lín; let humanity flourish in yang’s lament, granting longevity and prosperity. The nine heavens, nine lands, nine persons, nine destinies, nine perfected, nine Dao/Ways, nine arts, nine births, nine vastnesses, nine mysteries, nine essentials, and nine accomplishments—along with the one hundred and seventeen transcendent powers—ascend with Zhang Tian Gong, ensuring the world’s goodness without revelation.

The above fifty-one characters: When entering mountains or waters to subdue malevolent spirits, inscribe them in black on white silk and burn it over water to quell them. Do not let others know of this.

Summon the Dragon Spirit of the Nine Constructions: Remove, Full, Level, Establish, House, Ascend, Bright, Divine, Know, Bend, Destiny, Hook, Support, Bright, Fire, Three Persons, Radiance, Nine Heavens, and other spirits. The great Six Ghosts and Azure Omens retreat; destiny ascends in obeisance. Three flames must blaze; three stones and nine kings expel deceit. Hasten! Three Qian must not; nine nines transform nine heavens, nine oxen, two persons, fish, and transgressions. The world remains pure, and the nine unite in brightness, issuing destiny left and right.

The above seventy-four characters: Write with realgar on stone or tile and bury at the four corners of your dwelling. Do not let others know, for this summons the Wealth Spirit and Prosperity Spirit.

Four stones, mountain foxes, issuing destiny, prosperity’s gate—thus, women find peace within. Speak the words of Ye Liao; six left leaves, nine heavens, nine heavens, nine heavens—accomplished! This azure one!

The above thirty-four characters: Follow one seal script, write in red on white paper, and burn it daily on an empty stomach. Mix the ashes with water and consume. If the divine words foretell fortune, fortune comes; if misfortune, misfortune follows. Exhale to cure illness—none shall remain uncured.

The arcane words total two hundred and sixteen characters.

The above constitutes the **Esoteric Writings of the Three Sovereigns**. Those who study the Dao/Way must carry them, for only then may they commune with the divine. If one has not received the Daoist registers, they must not recklessly practice this. It is fitting to conceal them within renowned mountains and secluded valleys to avoid heavenly retribution. This method was not transmitted by the original master, lest the celestial mechanisms be revealed. Fellow students must speak sparingly of it, for slander against these sacred texts brings calamity upon oneself—suffering under royal law in life and hell in death. Be cautious, be most cautious; keep it secret, keep it most secret.

**The Secret Seal of the Yellow Spirit of Great Clarity**
Carve from the heartwood of a jujube tree struck by lightning, on the fifth day of the fifth month, or on a spring Jiazi day, or a summer Bingwu day.

For all who receive and hold this seal: On a Jiazi day at the hour of *rending* (9–11 PM), place it in a purified chamber. Offer three platters of fried cakes, cypress broth, and salted fermented beans. Bow twice and present incense. Declare: *"Today, this humble servant [your name] respectfully addresses the Dao Lord, August Heaven, and the Messenger of the Great Unity. I now carry this precious seal, wishing for freedom from illness within and the severance of all malevolence without. May it protect heaven and humanity, dispel spirits, and repel evil. May all I seek come naturally, uniting with the Dao/Way."* Present incense thrice, bow again, and conclude the petition.

**Diagram of the Yellow Spirit Seal of Great Clarity**
Square, 4.8 *cun* per side, 1.2 *cun* thick.

**Diagram of the Small Yue Chapter Seal**
Square, 4.8 *cun* per side, 1.2 *cun* thick.

**Diagram of the Nine Elders of the Immortal Capital Seal**
Perfectly square, 3.2 *cun* per side, 0.8 *cun* thick, with two lines of seal script.

The **Upper Clarity Seal of the Nine Elders of the Immortal Capital**: When carried while climbing mountains, wolves, tigers, and spectral beings submit of their own accord. Rivers and winds yield to safe passage. It commands the immortal officials and soldiers of grotto heavens. Wolves cannot harm, tigers cannot wound, waters cannot drown. In times of great peril, salvation is assured. For ordinary people, it extends lifespan, subdues malevolent ghosts, and repels all evil. To treat night terrors and convulsions in children, or various ailments in adults, burn it to ash, mix with frankincense decoction, and consume—efficacy is immediate. It hastens difficult births and expels stillborn fetuses, stabilizes pregnancies, and grants conception to barren women. It resolves curses, grievances, and injustices, sharpens the mind, and fulfills all uses. Treat it with reverence; do not slight it.

**The Inner Method of the Yellow Spirit Yue Chapter**

**Lineage of Masters**
Marshal Yuan Bo, with a blessed countenance and fiery crown, clad in golden armor, wielding a sword, and dressed in vermilion robes and shoes.

**The Talisman of the Great Mystery’s Messenger**
**Summoning Incantation**: *"Xuan Ying Lie Hong."*
**Summoning Talisman**: Visualize the officers and soldiers descending from the Dipper before you. Hold the talisman in the left hand and grasp it in the right, drawing the spirit’s qi and blowing it onto the talisman. Use the secret incantation where essence departs.

The **Secret Seal of the Yellow Spirit Yue Chapter** subdues all malevolence, along with various spectral disasters and urgent calamities. When meeting kings and great ministers, all shall rejoice, and all desires shall be fulfilled. Carry it constantly at the waist or in the sleeve, and hidden soldiers shall guard and assist. Do not recklessly transmit it to the unworthy, lest you incur heavenly retribution, bringing misfortune upon nine generations—regret shall be too late.

**Incantation of the Yue Chapter**:
*"The Yellow Spirit Yue Chapter of the Most High Lord Lao slays and vanquishes the ghostly soldiers of heaven and earth—how dare they resist! The Eastern Star of the Year, the Western Venus, the Northern Pole Star, the Southern Mars—great sages transform, annihilating ghostly essences, executing thieves and bandits, subduing all armies. Immortal youths and jade maidens, celestial and terrestrial spirits, Zhang Star drives away and captures all malevolent qi. The Well and Willow Stars transmit, the Horn Star pacifies. Demons and goblins are governed by destiny and summoned to the imperial court. The Three and Five govern malevolent qi, seize the register of death, inscribe the name of life. The stem of Wu destroys, the spirit of Yi is refined. Heavenly immortals descend to the disciple Yue Chapter. Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law and command of the Most High Lord Lao!"*

**Incantation of the Seal**:
*"Yellow Spirit of Heavenly Chapter, the imperial seal of the Yellow Spirit of the Celestial Court, capturing ghostly essences. The Eastern Dipper establishes the node by the Star of the Year; the Southern Dipper governs destiny and repels all armies. The Western Dipper’s Ladle and Scoop subdue ghostly essences; the Northern Dipper binds essence and reports to the imperial court. The Yellow Spirit slays ghosts and their qi alike; the Central Dipper’s Great Ladle is the Star of Mars."*

chunks.original_text: 角亢治气都会名，张星火毒除万兵。 大圣化神杀气横，牛历箕斗护身形。 罡武上帝寿五星，天皇使者斩邪精。 太上赐臣某黄神印章，急急如律令勅。 杀鬼咒 太上老君，教我杀鬼，与我神方，上呼玉女，收摄不祥，登山石裂，佩带印章，头戴华盖，足蹑魁罡，左扶六甲，右卫六丁，前有黄神，后有越章，神帅杀伐，不避豪强，先杀恶鬼，后斩夜光，何神不伏，何鬼敢当。 急急如律令。 勅瘟咒 勅东方青瘟之鬼腐木之精，南方赤瘟之鬼炎火之精，西方白瘟之鬼孔金之精，北方黑瘟之鬼渊池之精，中央黄瘟之鬼粪土之精。 四时八节，因旺而生，神不内养，外作邪精，五毒之气，入人身形，或寒或热，五体不宁。 九丑之鬼，知汝姓名，急须速去，不得久停。 急急如律令。 谨按祖天师汉安四年，在蜀与六天魔王战，夺二十四治，与会盟青城山黄帝坛下。 使人处阳明，鬼潜幽暗，令六天魔王领归北都，八部鬼帅领众窜於西域，五行之毒气从兹而释之。 析石为契，作天地日月之形，置之于绝崖，仍以神印封鬼营匝，使不得相通。 今以神符刊行，善信宜於净室香花供养，自然驱瘟辟恶，集福来祥，惟加至诚，无不感应。 龙虎山正一元坛谨白。 抱朴子曰：古之人皆佩此印，能辟虎豹及诸山兽。 以此印封泥，置四方各一百步，则虎狼不近其内也。 若行见新虎迹，以此印顺则虎去，逆则虎来。 非但虎狼，若山林庙座血食之神，能作祸福者，以印封泥四方块，其踪迹不能复神矣。 昔有石头，头有大龟，在潭为精作祸。 有道士戴炳者，以封泥数百块，乘船掷于潭中。 良久，大龟径长丈余，浮出不动，小龟罗列水上，其受祸者即安，今名为龟潭也。 若服此文，存心中赤童卫持，作二十四息。 书符可高五寸，阔四寸，作二十四，则使百禽恶兽奔走，止之则止，使之则使。 不但虎豹，以此符封鬼庙屋，大验。 太上曰：欲役鬼神者，先取鬼箭、鬼曰等分，各二两，阴乾捣为细末，用桑脓汁为丸，如梧桐子大。 每服七丸，早晨空心服之，浄水吞下，临外又服七丸。 至七七之后，一切鬼神八吏、六丁一玉女，皆来朝拜，狮虎皆受役。 七七之后，不可再服。 凡服，取旺方气一口，念咒曰： 百药之精，眼见鬼形，役使八吏，并及六丁，驱使鬼神，立即通灵，延年益寿，永得长生，白日升天，飞腾上清。 急急如律令。 旺方谓春东、夏南、秋西、冬北。 邪治病至诚用之，无不感应。 护身符身
chunks.translated_text:
The Horn and Neck govern the assembly of qi and names, the Star of Zhang and Fire expel the myriad armies. The Great Sage transforms spirits and slays rampant qi, the Ox, Sequence, Winnowing Basket, and Dipper shield the body’s form. The Stem of Wu and the Emperor of the Five Stars bestow longevity, the Celestial Sovereign’s Envoys slay malevolent essences. The Most High bestows upon your servant this Yellow Spirit Seal—swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law and command!

**Incantation to Slay Ghosts**:
*"Most High Lord Lao, teach me to slay ghosts, grant me divine methods. Above, I summon the Jade Maidens to gather and seize inauspiciousness. Ascend the mountain, and the rocks split; wear the seal, don the floral canopy, tread upon the Ladle and Stem. To the left, the Six Jia spirits lend support; to the right, the Six Ding spirits guard. Before me stands the Yellow Spirit; behind me, the Yue Chapter. Divine marshals strike and slay, unyielding to the mighty. First, they slay evil ghosts; next, they sever the night’s radiance. What spirit would not submit? What ghost would dare resist?"*
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law and command!

**Command Against Pestilence**:
*"I command the Eastern Green Pestilence ghosts, the essence of rotting wood; the Southern Red Pestilence ghosts, the essence of scorching fire; the Western White Pestilence ghosts, the essence of hollow metal; the Northern Black Pestilence ghosts, the essence of abyssal pools; the Central Yellow Pestilence ghosts, the essence of filth and earth. Born of the four seasons and eight nodes, thriving in their vigor, spirits unnurtured within turn outward to craft malevolent essences. The qi of the Five Poisons enters the human form, now cold, now hot, unsettling the five limbs. O Nine Ugly ghosts, I know your names—depart swiftly, tarry not!"*
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law and command!

Respectfully recorded: In the fourth year of Han’an, the Ancestral Celestial Master battled the Six Heavens’ Demon Kings in Shu, seizing the Twenty-Four Governances. At the Yellow Emperor’s altar on Mount Qingcheng, a covenant was sworn. Humans dwell in yang brightness; ghosts lurk in yin darkness. The Six Heavens’ Demon Kings were banished to the Northern Capital, the Eight Divisions’ ghostly marshals and their hosts driven into the Western Regions. The Five Phases’ toxic qi were thus released. Stone was split into contracts, carved with the forms of Heaven, Earth, Sun, and Moon, placed upon sheer cliffs. The divine seal encircled the ghostly encampments, severing their communication.

Now, these sacred talismans are disseminated. The devout should enshrine them in a purified chamber with incense and offerings. Naturally, they will dispel pestilence, repel evil, gather blessings, and summon auspiciousness. Only with utmost sincerity will there be no lack of response.
*Reverently proclaimed by the Orthodox Unity Original Altar of Mount Longhu.*

The *Baopuzi* states: "The ancients all wore this seal, which could repel tigers, leopards, and all mountain beasts. When sealing mud with this seal and placing it a hundred paces in each of the four directions, tigers and wolves will not approach. If one encounters fresh tiger tracks while traveling, imprinting the seal in alignment will drive the tiger away; imprinting it in reverse will summon the tiger. Not only tigers and wolves—if mountain forest shrines or blood-offering spirits capable of bringing fortune or misfortune are sealed with mud blocks in the four directions, their traces will no longer manifest their numinous power.

Once, there was a stone in a deep pool, atop which perched a great turtle that wrought calamity as a spirit. A Daoist named Dai Bing used several hundred blocks of sealed mud, casting them from a boat into the pool. After a long while, a turtle over a *zhang* in length floated motionless to the surface, while smaller turtles gathered upon the water. Those afflicted by its harm were immediately healed, and the place is now called Turtle Pool.

If one recites this text while visualizing a red youth guarding the heart, performing twenty-four breaths, and inscribes talismans five *cun* tall and four *cun* wide—twenty-four in total—then all birds and beasts, no matter how fierce, will flee. Command them to halt, and they halt; command them to act, and they obey. Not only tigers and leopards—sealing ghostly shrines with this talisman yields great efficacy.

The Most High said: "To command ghosts and spirits, first take equal parts of ghost arrows and ghost days, two *liang* each, dry them in the shade, and grind them into fine powder. Mix with mulberry sap to form pills the size of *wutong* seeds. Take seven pills on an empty stomach at dawn, swallowing them with pure water, and take seven more before going out. After forty-nine days, all ghosts and spirits, the Eight Officers, the Six Ding, and the Jade Maiden will come to pay homage, and even lions and tigers will submit to your command. After forty-nine days, do not take any more.

When taking the pills, inhale a mouthful of qi from the direction of the season’s vigor and recite the incantation:
*'Essence of a hundred medicines, eyes behold ghostly forms. Command the Eight Officers and the Six Ding, drive and employ ghosts and spirits, instantly attain communion. Prolong years and extend life, forever achieve longevity, ascend to Heaven in broad daylight, soar to the Supreme Clarity.'*
Swiftly, swiftly, as decreed by the law and command!

The direction of vigor refers to east in spring, south in summer, west in autumn, and north in winter. Use this with utmost sincerity to treat illnesses caused by malevolent forces—there will be no lack of response.

**Talisman for Body Protection**"
